subject: RE: [junit] JUnit cookbook error?
msgSnippet: You are also welcome to submit a patch via GitHub. We much prefer solutions to problems... Regards, Kent _____ From: junit@yahoogroups.com
messageBody:
You are also welcome to submit a patch via GitHub. We much prefer solutions
to problems...

Regards,

Kent

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
David Saff
Sent: Monday, May 04, 2009 6:27 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] JUnit cookbook error?





Yuck. Can you raise a bug on SourceForge? Thanks,

David Saff

On Sat, May 2, 2009 at 12:38 AM, Samuel Douglas <sam.douglas32@
<mailto:sam.douglas32%40gmail.com> gmail.com> wrote:
> Hi,
>
> Not entirely sure if this is the right place to post this, but in the
> JUnit cookbook, the instructions for running a test from the command
> line are wrong or misleading, at least for JUnit 4.6.
>
> or this from the command line, with both your test class and junit on
> the classpath:
>
> java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore TestClass1.class [...other test
classes...]
>
>
> The command should probably read:
>
> java org.junit.runner.JUnitCore package.TestClass1 [...other test
> classes...]
>
>
>
> -- Sam
>
>
> ------------------------------------
>
> Yahoo! Groups Links
>
>
>
>





[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
